      - `get_transactions_by_address(address, age_from)` - get all transactions to/from the address since the given date up to the current time
      - `get_transactions_by_address(address, age_from, age_to)` - get all transactions to/from the address between the given dates
      - `get_transactions_by_address(address, age_from, age_to, methods)` - get all transactions to/from the address between the given dates and invoking the given method signature
    Manipulating `age_from` and `age_to` allows you to paginate through results by time ranges.
    ', 'inputSchema': {'type': 'object', 'title': 'get_transactions_by_addressArguments', 'required': ['chain_id', 'address'], 'properties': {'age_to': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Age To', 'default': None, 'description': 'End date and time (e.g 2025-05-22T22:30:00.00Z).'}, 'address': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Address', 'description': 'Address which either sender or receiver of the transaction'}, 'methods': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Methods', 'default': None, 'description': 'A method signature to filter transactions by (e.g 0x304e6ade)'}, 'age_from': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Age From', 'default': None, 'description': 'Start date and time (e.g 2025-05-22T23:00:00.00Z).'}, 'chain_id': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Chain Id', 'description': 'The ID of the blockchain'}}}, 'source': 'smithery', 'access_level': 'write'}, {'name': 'get_token_transfers_by_address', 'description': '

      - `get_token_transfers_by_address(address, age_from)` - get all transfers of any ERC-20 token to/from the address since the given date up to the current time
      - `get_token_transfers_by_address(address, age_from, age_to)` - get all transfers of any ERC-20 token to/from the address between the given dates
      - `get_token_transfers_by_address(address, age_from, age_to, token)` - get all transfers of the given ERC-20 token to/from the address between the given dates
    Manipulating `age_from` and `age_to` allows you to paginate through results by time ranges. For example, after getting transfers up to a certain timestamp, you can use that timestamp as `age_to` in the next query to get the next page of older transfers.
    ', 'inputSchema': {'type': 'object', 'title': 'get_token_transfers_by_addressArguments', 'required': ['chain_id', 'address'], 'properties': {'token': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Token', 'default': None, 'description': 'An ERC-20 token contract address to filter transfers by a specific token. If omitted, returns transfers of all tokens.'}, 'age_to': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Age To', 'default': None, 'description': 'End date and time (e.g 2025-05-22T22:30:00.00Z). Can be omitted to get all transfers up to the current time.'}, 'address': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Address', 'description': 'Address which either transfer initiator or transfer receiver'}, 'age_from': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Age From', 'default': None, 'description': 'Start date and time (e.g 2025-05-22T23:00:00.00Z). This parameter should be provided in most cases to limit transfers and avoid heavy database queries. Omit only if you absolutely need the full history.'}, 'chain_id': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Chain Id', 'description': 'The ID of the blockchain'}}}, 'source': 'smithery', 'access_level': 'write'}, {'name': 'lookup_token_by_symbol', 'description': '

    Get comprehensive information about an address, including:

    ', 'inputSchema': {'type': 'object', 'title': 'get_address_infoArguments', 'required': ['chain_id', 'address'], 'properties': {'address': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Address', 'description': 'Address to get information about'}, 'chain_id': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Chain Id', 'description': 'The ID of the blockchain'}}}, 'source': 'smithery', 'access_level': 'write'}, {'name': 'get_tokens_by_address', 'description': '

    ', 'inputSchema': {'type': 'object', 'title': 'transaction_summaryArguments', 'required': ['chain_id', 'transaction_hash'], 'properties': {'chain_id': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Chain Id', 'description': 'The ID of the blockchain'}, 'transaction_hash': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Transaction Hash', 'description': 'Transaction hash'}}}, 'source': 'smithery', 'access_level': 'read'}, {'name': 'nft_tokens_by_address', 'description': "
    Retrieve NFT tokens (ERC-721, ERC-404, ERC-1155) owned by an address, grouped by collection.
    Provides collection details (type, address, name, symbol, total supply, holder count) and individual token instance data (ID, name, description, external URL, metadata attributes).
    Essential for a detailed overview of an address's digital collectibles and their associated collection data.

    Get comprehensive transaction information.

    By default, the raw transaction input is omitted if a decoded version is available to save context; request it with `include_raw_input=True` only when you truly need the raw hex data.

    Get comprehensive transaction logs.

    ', 'inputSchema': {'type': 'object', 'title': 'get_transaction_logsArguments', 'required': ['chain_id', 'transaction_hash'], 'properties': {'cursor': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Cursor', 'default': None, 'description': 'The pagination cursor from a previous response to get the next page of results.'}, 'chain_id': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Chain Id', 'description': 'The ID of the blockchain'}, 'transaction_hash': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Transaction Hash', 'description': 'Transaction hash'}}}, 'source': 'smithery', 'access_level': 'read'}, {'name': 'get_address_logs', 'description': '
    Get comprehensive logs emitted by a specific address.

    Essential for analyzing smart contract events emitted by specific addresses, monitoring token contract activities, tracking DeFi protocol state changes, debugging contract event emissions, and understanding address-specific event history flows.
    ', 'inputSchema': {'type': 'object', 'title': 'get_address_logsArguments', 'required': ['chain_id', 'address'], 'properties': {'cursor': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}], 'title': 'Cursor', 'default': None, 'description': 'The pagination cursor from a previous response to get the next page of results.'}, 'address': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Address', 'description': 'Account address'}, 'chain_id': {'type': 'string', 'title': 'Chain Id', 'description': 'The ID of the blockchain'}}}, 'source': 'smithery', 'access_level': 'write'}, {'name': 'get_chains_list', 'description': '
    Get the list of known blockchain chains with their IDs.

raw_output:
# Blockscout MCP Server

This is a comprehensive blockchain data analysis server that provides AI agents with contextual access to multi-chain blockchain data through the Blockscout infrastructure.

## Overview

The Blockscout MCP Server enables seamless integration between AI systems (like Claude Desktop) and blockchain explorers, offering rich blockchain data analysis capabilities including balances, tokens, NFTs, smart contracts, and transaction details across multiple blockchain networks.

## Key Features

- **Multi-chain Support**: Access data across various blockchain networks
- **Comprehensive Data Access**: Balances, tokens, NFTs, contracts, transactions, and logs
- **Enhanced User Experience**: Progress notifications for long-running queries
- **Smart Contract Analysis**: ABI retrieval, proxy detection, and contract verification status
- **Transaction Intelligence**: Human-readable summaries and detailed breakdowns
- **ENS Resolution**: Convert ENS domain names to addresses

## Available Tools (16 total)

### Essential Setup
- `__get_instructions__` - **Must be called first** before using any other tools

### Chain Information
- `get_chains_list` - Get list of supported blockchain networks with their IDs
- `get_latest_block` - Get the most recent indexed block information
- `get_block_info` - Detailed block information including transactions

### Address & ENS
- `get_address_info` - Comprehensive address analysis (balance, contract status, proxy info)
- `get_address_by_ens_name` - Resolve ENS domains to Ethereum addresses

### Transactions
- `get_transactions_by_address` - Transaction history for specific addresses with time filtering
- `get_transaction_info` - Detailed transaction data with decoded parameters
- `get_transaction_logs` - Comprehensive transaction logs with decoded events
- `transaction_summary` - Human-readable transaction summaries

### Tokens & NFTs
- `get_tokens_by_address` - ERC-20 token holdings with market data
- `get_token_transfers_by_address` - ERC-20 transfer history with filtering
- `lookup_token_by_symbol` - Search tokens by symbol or name
- `nft_tokens_by_address` - NFT collections and tokens owned by an address

### Smart Contracts
- `get_contract_abi` - Retrieve smart contract ABIs
- `get_address_logs` - Logs emitted by specific contract addresses

## Use Cases

- **Portfolio Analysis**: Track token holdings and NFT collections
- **Transaction Investigation**: Analyze complex DeFi operations and smart contract interactions
- **Smart Contract Auditing**: Examine contract code, ABIs, and proxy relationships
- **DeFi Research**: Monitor protocol interactions and token flows
- **Wallet Tracking**: Comprehensive address activity analysis
- **Market Analysis**: Token metrics and holder statistics

## Integration

Designed for seamless integration with AI hosts like Claude Desktop, providing blockchain developers, analysts, and researchers with powerful data analysis capabilities through natural language interfaces.

Visit the [homepage](https://smithery.ai/server/@blockscout/mcp-server) for more information and setup instructions.

# Baidu AI Search

Baidu AI Search is a comprehensive web search service powered by Baidu Cloud's AI capabilities. It's part of the Baidu AppBuilder-SDK, which is a one-stop development platform for AI-native applications.

## Key Features

### Core Capabilities
- **Large Model Integration**: Direct access to models from Baidu's Qianfan platform with customizable prompts
- **40+ Premium Components**: Built-in components from Baidu's ecosystem for Agent applications
- **AI Application Management**: Access and manage AI applications through AppBuilderClient
- **Knowledge Base Management**: Full CRUD operations for documents and knowledge snippets
- **Workflow Orchestration**: Multi-level abstractions (Message, Component, AgentRuntime) with LangChain and OpenAI compatibility

### Advanced Features
- **Visual Tracing & Debug Logs**: Comprehensive monitoring tools for production environments
- **Flexible Deployment**: Support for Flask/Gunicorn API services and Chainlit interactive frontends
- **Cloud Deployment**: Quick deployment to Baidu Cloud with public API services

## Industrial-Grade RAG Applications

The SDK provides complete coverage for building production-ready RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) applications:

- **Document Processing**: Advanced parsing, format conversion, and OCR capabilities
- **Text Chunking**: Intelligent document splitting for optimal retrieval
- **Vector Operations**: Embedding generation and vector database integration
- **Retrieval Systems**: Support for VectorDB and Elasticsearch-based retrieval
- **Answer Generation**: Advanced LLM components for query processing and response generation

## Available Tools

I have access to several key components of the Baidu AI Search system:

1. **RAG Application** - For retrieval-augmented generation tasks
2. **Message Processing** - For workflow orchestration and text processing
3. **AgentRuntime** - For deploying applications as API services
4. **Playground** - For testing and experimenting with large language models
5. **Deployment Tools** - For cloud deployment and service management

## Getting Started

The system requires Python 3.9+ and can be installed via:
```bash
python3 -m pip install --upgrade appbuilder-sdk
```

Would you like me to help you with any specific AI search tasks or demonstrate any of these capabilities?

raw_output:
# Binance Cryptocurrency Market Data Service

This is a comprehensive MCP (Model Context Protocol) server that provides real-time cryptocurrency market data from Binance directly to AI agents. It enables seamless access to current prices, order books, candlestick charts, trading history, and price statistics without needing to visit external sites.

## üöÄ Features

- **Real-time Market Data**: Access live cryptocurrency prices and market information
- **Order Book Data**: Get current buy/sell orders with customizable depth
- **Trading History**: Retrieve recent and historical trade data
- **Candlestick Charts**: Access K-line data for technical analysis
- **Price Statistics**: Get 24-hour tickers, rolling window stats, and average prices
- **Multiple Symbol Support**: Query data for single or multiple trading pairs

## üõ†Ô∏è Available Tools

### Order Book & Trading Data
- **`get_order_book`** - Retrieve current order book with bid/ask prices
- **`get_recent_trades`** - Get the most recent trades for a symbol
- **`get_historical_trades`** - Access historical trading data
- **`get_aggregate_trades`** - Get compressed trade data

### Chart Data
- **`get_klines`** - Retrieve candlestick/K-line data for charts
- **`get_ui_klines`** - Get UI-optimized K-line data

### Price Information
- **`get_price`** - Get current price for trading pairs
- **`get_avg_price`** - Retrieve average price over time
- **`get_book_ticker`** - Get best bid/ask prices
- **`get_24hr_ticker`** - 24-hour price change statistics
- **`get_trading_day_ticker`** - Trading day statistics
- **`get_rolling_window_ticker`** - Rolling window price statistics

## üìä Supported Trading Pairs

All Binance spot trading pairs are supported, including:
- **BTC pairs**: BTCUSDT, BTCEUR, BTCGBP, etc.
- **ETH pairs**: ETHUSDT, ETHBTC, ETHEUR, etc.
- **Major altcoins**: ADAUSDT, DOTUSDT, LINKUSDT, etc.
- **Stablecoins**: BUSDUSDT, USDCUSDT, etc.

## üîß Usage Examples

### Get Current Bitcoin Price
```json
{
  "tool": "get_price",
  "parameters": {
    "symbol": "BTCUSDT"
  }
}
```

### Get Order Book Depth
```json
{
  "tool": "get_order_book",
  "parameters": {
    "symbol": "ETHUSDT",
    "limit": 100
  }
}
```

### Get Daily Candlestick Data
```json
{
  "tool": "get_klines",
  "parameters": {
    "symbol": "BTCUSDT",
    "interval": "1d",
    "limit": 30
  }
}
```

### Get 24-Hour Statistics for Multiple Pairs
```json
{
  "tool": "get_24hr_ticker",
  "parameters": {
    "symbols": ["BTCUSDT", "ETHUSDT", "ADAUSDT"]
  }
}
```

## üìà Time Intervals

Supported K-line intervals:
- **Minutes**: 1m, 3m, 5m, 15m, 30m
- **Hours**: 1h, 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 12h
- **Days**: 1d, 3d
- **Weeks**: 1w
- **Months**: 1M

## üîí Access Levels

- **Read Access**: Price data, order books, K-lines
- **Execute Access**: Trade history and aggregate data retrieval

## üåê Installation

Visit the [Smithery page](https://smithery.ai/server/@snjyor/binance-mcp-data) for installation instructions and setup details.

## üí° Use Cases

- **Trading Bots**: Get real-time data for algorithmic trading
- **Market Analysis**: Perform technical analysis with historical data
- **Portfolio Tracking**: Monitor cryptocurrency investments
- **Price Alerts**: Set up notifications based on price movements
- **Research**: Analyze market trends and trading patterns

This MCP server makes it easy to integrate Binance's comprehensive cryptocurrency market data into AI-powered applications and workflows.

raw_output:
# Heurist Mesh Network

The **Heurist Mesh Network** is a comprehensive MCP server that provides access to specialized web3 AI agents for blockchain analysis, smart contract security, token metrics, and blockchain interactions.

## Overview

Heurist Mesh is an open network where AI agents are contributed by the community and used modularly‚Äîsimilar to DeFi smart contracts. Each agent is a specialized unit that can process data, generate reports, or perform actions while collectively forming an intelligent swarm to tackle complex tasks.

## Key Features

- üîó **Unified API Access** - All mesh agents accessible via REST API and MCP
- üõ°Ô∏è **Security Analysis** - Smart contract security auditing and token analysis
- üìä **Market Intelligence** - Real-time trading data and token metrics
- üåê **Multi-Chain Support** - Works across various blockchain networks
- ü§ñ **Specialized Agents** - Community-contributed agents for specific tasks
- üîÑ **Modular Design** - Mix and match agents for complex workflows

## Recommended Mesh Agents

### Token & Market Analysis
- **BitquerySolanaTokenInfoAgent** - Comprehensive Solana token analysis including metrics, holders, and trading activity
- **CoinGeckoTokenInfoAgent** - Token information, market data, and trending coins from CoinGecko
- **DexScreenerTokenInfoAgent** - Real-time DEX trading data across multiple chains
- **PumpFunTokenAgent** - Specialized analysis for Pump.fun tokens

### Security & Risk Assessment
- **GoplusAnalysisAgent** - Security analysis of blockchain token contracts
- **MetaSleuthSolTokenWalletClusterAgent** - Wallet cluster analysis for Solana tokens to identify holder behavior and potential manipulation

### Intelligence & Research
- **ElfaTwitterIntelligenceAgent** - Analyzes tokens and Twitter accounts using social media data
- **ExaSearchAgent** - Web search with direct answers to questions

## Getting Started

1. **Get API Access**: Visit [heurist.ai/dev-access](https://heurist.ai/dev-access) and use code 'agent' for free access
2. **Set up MCP**: Follow the [heurist-mesh-mcp-server](https://github.com/heurist-network/heurist-mesh-mcp-server) setup guide
3. **Start Using**: Access agents from Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf, or any MCP-compatible client

## Use Cases

- **DeFi Research** - Analyze tokens, liquidity pools, and trading patterns
- **Security Auditing** - Assess smart contract risks and token safety
- **Market Analysis** - Track trends, holder distributions, and trading activity
- **Social Intelligence** - Monitor Twitter sentiment and influencer activity
- **Portfolio Management** - Research and validate investment opportunities

## Architecture

The framework features a modular architecture with:
- **Core Agent** - Advanced LLM integration
- **Component System** - Plug-and-play design
- **Workflow Engine** - RAG, Chain of Thought, and Research workflows
- **Multi-platform Support** - Telegram, Discord, Twitter, Farcaster, REST API, and MCP

## Community & Development

- **Open Source** - Contribute your own specialized agents
- **Community Driven** - Agents developed and maintained by the community
- **Extensible** - Easy to add new tools and integrations
- **Well Documented** - Comprehensive guides and examples

Perfect for developers, traders, researchers, and anyone working with blockchain data who needs specialized AI agents for web3 analysis and automation.

Wren Engine

> Wren Engine is the Semantic Engine for MCP Clients and AI Agents. > [Wren AI](https://github.com/Canner/WrenAI) GenBI AI Agent is based on Wren Engine. ## üîå Supported Data Sources - [BigQuery](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/BigQueryConnectionInfo) - [Google Cloud Storage](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/GcsFileConnectionInfo) - [Local Files](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/LocalFileConnectionInfo) - [MS SQL Server](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/MSSqlConnectionInfo) - [Minio](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/MinioFileConnectionInfo) - [MySQL Server](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/MySqlConnectionInfo) - [Oracle Server](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/OracleConnectionInfo) - [PostgreSQL Server](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/PostgresConnectionInfo) - [Amazon S3](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/S3FileConnectionInfo) - [Snowflake](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/SnowflakeConnectionInfo) - [Trino](https://docs.getwren.ai/oss/wren_engine_api#tag/TrinoConnectionInfo) ## üò´ Challenge Today At the enterprise level, the stakes - and the complexity - are much higher. Businesses run on structured data stored in cloud warehouses, relational databases, and secure filesystems. From BI dashboards to CRM updates and compliance workflows, AI must not only execute commands but also **understand and retrieve the right data, with precision and in context**. While many community and official MCP servers already support connections to major databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, and more, there's a problem: **raw access to data isn't enough**. Enterprises need: - Accurate semantic understanding of their data models - Trusted calculations and aggregations in reporting - Clarity on business terms, like "active customer," "net revenue," or "churn rate" - User-based permissions and access control Natural language alone isn't enough to drive complex workflows across enterprise data systems. You need a layer that interprets intent, maps it to the correct data, applies calculations accurately, and ensures security. ## üéØ Our Mission Wren Engine is on a mission to power the future of MCP clients and AI agents through the Model Context Protocol (MCP) ‚Äî a new open standard that connects LLMs with tools, databases, and enterprise systems. As part of the MCP ecosystem, Wren Engine provides a **semantic engine** powered the next generation semantic layer that enables AI agents to access business data with accuracy, context, and governance. By building the semantic layer directly into MCP clients, such as Claude, Cline, Cursor, etc. Wren Engine empowers AI Agents with precise business context and ensures accurate data interactions across diverse enterprise environments. We believe the future of enterprise AI lies in **context-aware, composable systems**. That‚Äôs why Wren Engine is designed to be: - üîå **Embeddable** into any MCP client or AI agentic workflow - üîÑ **Interoperable** with modern data stacks (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Snowflake, etc.) - üß† **Semantic-first**, enabling AI to ‚Äúunderstand‚Äù your data model and business logic - üîê **Governance-ready**, respecting roles, access controls, and definitions With Wren Engine, you can scale AI adoption across teams ‚Äî not just with better automation, but with better understanding. ***Check our full article*** ü§© [Our Mission - Fueling the Next Wave of AI Agents: Building the Foundation for Future MCP Clients and Enterprise Data Access](https://getwren.ai/post/fueling-the-next-wave-of-ai-agents-building-the-foundation-for-future-mcp-clients-and-enterprise-data-access) ## üöÄ Get Started with MCP [MCP Server README](mcp-server/README.md) https: [...truncated for length...]', 'tools': [], 'tools_count': 0, 'homepage': '', 'url': 'https://github.com/Canner/wren-engine', 'topics': ['business-intelligence', 'data', 'data-analysis', 'data-analytics', 'data-lake', 'data-warehouse', 'sql', 'semantic', 'semantic-layer', 'llm', 'hacktoberfest', 'agent', 'agentic-ai', 'ai', 'mcp', 'mcp-server'], 'data_sources': ['official']}
raw_output:
# Wren Engine - Semantic Engine for MCP

Wren Engine is a semantic layer engine designed specifically for Model Context Protocol (MCP) clients and AI agents. It bridges the gap between natural language queries and enterprise data systems by providing contextual understanding of business data models.

## Key Features

- **Semantic Data Understanding**: Interprets business logic and data relationships rather than just raw database access
- **Enterprise-Ready**: Built for complex business environments with proper governance and access controls
- **MCP Integration**: Native support for the Model Context Protocol standard
- **Multi-Database Support**: Works with 11+ data sources including major cloud warehouses and databases

## Supported Data Sources

- **Cloud Warehouses**: BigQuery, Snowflake
- **Databases**: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle
- **Cloud Storage**: Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, Minio
- **Files**: Local file systems
- **Query Engines**: Trino

## Enterprise Focus

Unlike basic database connectors, Wren Engine addresses enterprise needs:

- **Business Context**: Understands terms like "active customer" or "net revenue" 
- **Accurate Calculations**: Ensures trusted aggregations and reporting
- **Access Control**: Respects user permissions and data governance
- **Semantic Mapping**: Translates natural language intent to precise data operations

## Architecture

Wren Engine serves as an intermediary layer that:
1. Receives natural language queries from MCP clients
2. Maps them to semantic business definitions
3. Generates appropriate SQL queries
4. Returns contextually accurate results

This approach enables AI agents to work with enterprise data systems more reliably than direct database access alone.

The engine is designed to be embeddable, interoperable, and governance-ready for scaling AI adoption across enterprise teams.

Prediction markets [[EVM](https://github.com/goat-sdk/goat/tree/main/typescript/examples/by-use-case/evm-bet-on-polymarket)] - Purchase crypto assets [[EVM](https://github.com/goat-sdk/goat/tree/main/typescript/examples/by-use-case/evm-swap-tokens), [Solana](https://github.com/goat-sdk/goat/tree/main/typescript/examples/by-use-case/solana-swap-tokens)] - **Tokenization** - Tokenize non-fungible assets [[EVM](https://github.com/goat-sdk/goat/tree/main/typescript/examples/by-use-case/evm-mint-nf [...truncated for length...]', 'tools': [], 'tools_count': 0, 'homepage': '', 'url': 'https://github.com/goat-sdk/goat/tree/main/typescript/examples/by-framework/model-context-protocol', 'topics': ['agents', 'ai', 'blockchain', 'crypto'], 'data_sources': ['official']}
raw_output:
# GOAT SDK - AI Agent Finance Toolkit

GOAT is the **largest agentic finance toolkit** for AI agents, enabling them to perform over 200 onchain actions across multiple blockchains including Ethereum, Solana, and Base.

## üéØ What GOAT Enables

**Create AI agents that can:**
- üí∏ Send and receive payments
- üõí Purchase physical and digital goods/services  
- üìà Execute investment strategies (yield farming, prediction markets, crypto trading)
- ü™ô Tokenize any asset
- üìä Get financial insights

## üèóÔ∏è How It Works

GOAT uses blockchain infrastructure to make AI agents economic actors:

1. **Give your agent a wallet** - Support for multiple wallet types
2. **Enable transactions anywhere** - Cross-chain compatibility
3. **Access 200+ tools** - Comprehensive toolkit
4. **Use any agent framework** - Framework agnostic

## üåü Key Features

### Lightweight & Modular
- Install only the tools you need
- Minimal core with extensible architecture
- Easy to create custom plugins

### Multi-Chain Support
- **EVM chains** (Ethereum, Base, etc.)
- **Solana**
- **Cosmos**
- **Chromia**
- **Fuel**
- **Radix**
- **Zetrix**

### Use Cases Examples

**üí∞ Money Transmission**
- Send/receive tokens across chains
- Cross-chain payments

**üõçÔ∏è Commerce**  
- Purchase items on Amazon with crypto
- E-commerce integrations

**üìä DeFi & Investing**
- Yield farming strategies
- Token swapping
- Prediction market betting
- Liquidity provision

**üé® Tokenization**
- Mint NFTs
- Create fungible tokens
- Asset tokenization

## üöÄ Quick Start

The SDK supports both TypeScript and Python implementations. Examples are organized by:

- **Use case** (payments, commerce, investing, tokenization)
- **Chain** (EVM, Solana, Cosmos, etc.)  
- **Agent framework** (various AI frameworks)

## üîß Integration

GOAT integrates with multiple:
- **Blockchains** - 7+ supported chains
- **Wallets** - Various wallet providers
- **Agent Frameworks** - Framework agnostic design

## üìã License

MIT Licensed - Free and open source

---

**Repository**: [goat-sdk/goat](https://github.com/goat-sdk/goat)  
**MCP Integration**: Available in the examples directory

GOAT democratizes financial capabilities for AI agents, making it easy to build economically-enabled AI systems across the decentralized ecosystem.
